alert.note: Alert for Holmes; Jackson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 2:31PM EDT until April 05 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Geneva County in southeastern Alabama... Southwestern Houston County in southeastern Alabama... Northwestern Jackson County in the Panhandle of Florida... Northeastern Holmes County in the Panhandle of Florida... * Until 215 PM CDT. * At 131 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hartford to 12 miles southwest of Geneva, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Graceville, Dothan, Hartford, Taylor, Slocomb, Malvern, Rehobeth, Esto, Noma, Black, Kellys Crossroads, Tendil Crossing, Southern Junction, Holland Crossroads, Merritts Crossroads, Hendrix Crossroad, Light, Cobb Crossroads, Smith Crossroads and Izagora. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for southeastern Alabama...and the Panhandle of Florida. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 600 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Florida. A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted, act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for southeastern Alabama...and the Panhandle of Florida. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 600 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Florida.
